extends Closeable

Field Detail

EOF

static final char EOF
End of file character.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getFile

String getFile()
Get the scanned file name. This may be any string, if not scanning from a real file.

Returns:
Return file name string.

createPosition

Position createPosition()
Creates a {Position} from the current line and column in the input stream.

Returns:
Return always new instance.

checkNewline

void checkNewline()
Checks if the current character is a new line character (\n or \r) and if it is increments the line counter and resets the column counter to 0.

raiseError

void raiseError(String msg)
                throws SyntaxException
Throws a {SyntaxException} with the current {Position} in the input stream.

Parameters:
msg - Describes raised error..
Throws:
SyntaxException - On syntax errors.

getCurrentCharacter

char getCurrentCharacter()
Returns the character at the current cursor from the input stream.

Returns:
The current character.

hasNextCharacter

boolean hasNextCharacter()
Returns if there is a next character in the input stream.

Returns:
If there is one more character.

nextCharacter

void nextCharacter()
                   throws IOException
Increments the character cursor.

Throws:
IOException - On IO errors caused by the input reader.

backupCharacter

void backupCharacter()
Decrements the character cursor.

peekCharacter

char peekCharacter()
                   throws IOException
Returns next character without advancing the cursor.

Returns:
Returns peeked character.
Throws:
IOException - On IO errors of scanned source.

hasNextToken

boolean hasNextToken()
Returns if there are more tokens. This is always true if never TokenAccess.nextToken() was called. No more tokens are indicated if the current token is of type TokenType.EOF.

Returns:
True if nextToken() will advance one more token.

nextToken

void nextToken()
               throws SyntaxException,
                      IOException
Start the scanning of the next token. This method should be called until hasNextToken() returns false.

Throws:
SyntaxException - On syntax errors.
IOException - On input stream IO errors.

peekToken

Token peekToken()
                throws SyntaxException,
                       IOException
Returns the next token without advancing the internal pointer (aka. lookahead). A call to TokenAccess.nextToken() will return this token ahead.

Returns:
Return peeked token.
Throws:
SyntaxException - On syntax errors.
IOException - On input stream IO errors.

getCurrentToken

Token getCurrentToken()
Returns the current scanned token. May be null if never TokenAccess.nextToken() was called.

Returns:
Returns always same instance until the current token is advanced by nextToken().

backtrackToken

void backtrackToken()
Backtrack current token one token.

backtrackToken

void backtrackToken(int count)
Backtrack current token n token.

Parameters:
count - How many tokens to back track.
